summary: This bill, the "Enhancing Native Elders' Longevity, Dignity, Empowerment, and Respect Act" (or Native ELDER Act), amends the Older Americans Act of 1965 to improve support for Native American elders. It establishes an Older Americans Tribal Advisory Committee to advise the Assistant Secretary on related matters. The bill also amends provisions regarding in-home assistance, funding, and technical assistance programs. It mandates reports on caregiver programs, in-home service needs, and barriers to tribal program access, as well as a report from the Secretary of Labor concerning funding recipients and services to Native American elders. It aims to improve healthcare access and quality of life.
